content.text: In this experiment, you will investigate an electrical circuit

You have been provided with a metre rule with a wire attached. You have also been provided with six identical resistors. Four of the resistors are connected in series and attached to a wooden block. The other resistors are labelled X and Z
The length of the rod is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
Measure and record \(L\)
The mass of the rod is \(M\)
Measure and record \(M\)
Calculate S, where
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(S\)
Rotate the rod horizontally through \(90^{\circ}\)
Release the rod. The rod will oscillate
Take measurements to determine the period \(T\) of these oscillations
Remove the hook from the rubber band
Remove the \(50 \text{g}\) masses from the rod
Place the \(10 \text{g}\) masses on the rod so that their centres are approximately \(9 \text{cm}\) apart
Place the hook on the rubber band
Adjust the position of the masses until the rod is parallel to the bench and each mass is the same distance \(a\) from the wire
Measure and record \(a\)
a =

T =

Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in **(e)**
Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and a reason for the uncertainty
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a rod
